notesStmt.note: At one point, this manuscript likely formed part of Whitman's cultural geography scrapbook. This manuscript is pasted down, making the verso inaccessible.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Phonology
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original item.

list.item: Phonology.—sounds—writing where each sound has a specific character
Ideology—science of the mind—history, elucidation, and illustration of human ideas
Biology—science of the mystery of life—/term introduced by TreverarnusTreviranus of Bremen, instead of physiology
Psychology—science of man's spiritual nature, or—or of the soul
Etiology—an account of the causes of anything, particularly diseases.—
